Course Description: INSTRUCTION IN STANDARD BOOKKEEPING PROCEDURES FOR SMALL PROFESSIONAL, SERVICE, AND RETAIL SOLE PROPRIETORSHIPS. ATTENTION IS GIVEN TO JOURNALIZING, POSTING, PREPARING THE TRIAL BALANCE AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PROCEDURES FOR HANDLING PETTY CASH, BANK DEPOSITS AND WITHDRAWALS, PAYROLL BUSINESS TAX REPORTS, AND SPECIAL JOURNALS ARE INCLUDED. THIS COURSE IS PRIMARILY FOR THE NON- ACCOUNTING MAJOR OR FOR THOSE WHO NEED ADDITIONAL BACKGROUND PRIOR TO TAKING ACG2001, PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING I. SUPPLEMENTARY REVIEW AND PRACTICE IN APPLYING ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES IS AVAILABLE THROUGH USAGE OF COMPUTER ASSISTED INSTRUCTIONAL SOFTWARE. PREREQUISITE: MTB1103, SUGGESTED
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
